meanings.definition: The beliefs and practices of Unitarians.
meanings.sent1: Unitarianisms emphasize individual freedom of belief.
meanings.sent2: She studied different unitarianisms to understand their diversity.
meanings.sent3: The lively debate about unitarianisms made her rethink her own views.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of beliefs, unitarianisms bloom like colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The essence of unitarianisms is acceptance and inclusivity.

meanings.sent1: Understanding unitarianisms requires studying their core principles.
meanings.sent2: Unitarianisms promote the idea of unity in diversity.
meanings.sent3: The book on unitarianisms was so engaging, she read it in one sitting.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to unitarianisms was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of unitarianisms makes them appealing to many.

meanings.definition: The doctrine or belief of Unitarians.
meanings.sent1: Unitarianisms have evolved over time to reflect modern values.
meanings.sent2: She found comfort in the unitarianisms of her community.
meanings.sent3: The playful debate about unitarianisms lightened the mood in the room.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to unitarianisms was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The core of unitarianisms is a belief in the inherent goodness of people.
